value.title: Another player heats up generative AI race as China introduces interim laws
value.excerpt: JD.com launches its large language model ChatRhino, which it says hits 100 billion parameters, amid new regulations in China to manage generative AI services.

value.title: A top AI expert says the technology is still in its very early phase: 'We're only at the iPhone 2G, 3G point.'
value.excerpt: Stability AI's CEO, Emad Mostaque, said during a roundtable discussion that he believed the real force of AI would be felt next year.

value.title: KPMG is making a $2 billion bet on AI. It's another example of big changes that are coming to the workplace.
value.excerpt: KPMG advises businesses around the world. It's teaming with Microsoft to bring AI to more of them. Get ready for the new tech to spread even faster.

value.title: Elon Musk unveils new AI startup with team of top researchers
value.excerpt: The startup, xAI, formally launched on Wednesday and its goal “is to understand the true nature of the universe.”

value.title: How AI startup Runway is trying to make content creation faster and easier, according to its cofounder

value.title: How Will AI Impact the Future of Your Work?

value.title: AI and cybersecurity: Friends, foes, collaborators

value.title: AMD-powered LUMI supercomputer lets TurkuNLP create new AI models quickly
value.excerpt: Powered by Advanced Micro Devices chips, the LUMI supercomputer – recently ranked as the fastest supercomputer in Europe as well as one of the most energy efficient – has enabled the TurkuNLP Group to create new models quickly.

value.title: Daniel Ek’s Neko Health raises $65M for AI-driven preventative healthcare solutions

value.title: Business leaders fret about generative AI despite growing enterprise adoption: Study
value.excerpt: The study found that 90% of business leaders anticipate adopting generative AI and that it will impact important organizational roles.

value.title: AWS exec downplays existential threat of AI, calls it a ‘mathematical parlor trick’
value.excerpt: AI is not a threat, says Matt Wood of AWS — rather, it has powerful, transformative potential for enterprises of all sizes.
